title: Dr. Contessa Metcalfe Shares Essential Tips for Winter Wellness on TipsOnTV | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
Stay Ahead of Cold, Flu, and COVID Season with these Health Tips.
ATLANTA, GEORGIA / ACCESS Newswire / January 23, 2025 / During the winter months, staying healthy is always challenging. That is why winter wellness is all about taking proactive steps to help keep the whole family safe and healthy. Almost daily, people are confronted with new health issues that impact individuals and families. However, there are solutions for promoting health and wellness, including exercise, diet, and even daily supplements. Contessa Metcalfe, MD, physician and reality TV star, offers timely tips and products for winter wellness. Dr. Contessa Metcalfe Shares Ways to Stay Healthy & Wellness this Winter
'Married to Medicine' Star Dr. Contessa Metcalfe Gives Tips for Staying Healthy
A TOP TIP FOR BETTER HEALTH
One of the most important parts of any winter wellness routine is a good night's sleep. When sleep routines are disrupted by travel or other changes, Boiron's SleepCalm can help restore a healthy sleep pattern. Available in melatonin-free formulas for both adults and kids, SleepCalm is a must-have in the wellness arsenal. This non-habit-forming sleep aid gently relieves occasional sleeplessness and restless sleep. Boiron's SleepCalm comes in meltaway tablets for anyone 12 and up, and pre-measured liquid doses for children ages 3 and up. For more information, visit www.boironusa.com .
TIPS FOR HELPING LITTLE ONES THROUGH COLD AND FLU SEASON
Babies can only breathe through their noses for the first 12 months, so when babies are congested, breathing, feeding, and sleeping are difficult. That is why parents need a solution they can trust, like the pediatrician-recommended Nav√§ge Baby Aspirator. Baby-safe, drug-free, and designed to last longer, the Nav√§ge Baby Aspirator does not clog like other brands and provides big relief for little noses that parents and caregivers can truly rely on. It also makes a great gift. Find Nav√§ge Baby solutions online at navage.com and at Walmart .

title: Resguardo policial reapareci√≥ en la plaza Murillo que no estaba cuando ingresaron los militares | El Deber
text: Resguardo policial reapareci√≥ en la plaza Murillo que no estaba cuando ingresaron los militares Este jueves no solo los efectivos de la UTOP est√°n, tambi√©n los Delta y el GEA aparecieron en la plaza controlando todos los accesos El resguardo policial que siempre est√° presente en la plaza Murillo reapareci√≥ este jueves con distintas unidades y no solo con la UTOP, que es la unidad a cargo de la seguridad en la hist√≥rica plaza, hubieron efectivos de otras reparticiones policiales. El mi√©rcoles cuando ingresaron los militares inexplicablemente oficiales de la UTOP no estaban. ‚ÄúLos militares ingresaron con armas de guerra y expulsaron a todos de la plaza Murillo‚Äù, fue la evasiva explicaci√≥n que ensay√≥ el viceministro Jhonny Aguilera cuando le consultaron sobre las razones de la ausencia de polic√≠as que est√°n custodiando la plaza todos los d√≠as y a toda hora. La Unidad T√°ctica de Operaciones Policiales (UTOP) tiene su cuartel a media cuadra de la plaza Murillo, al lado de la Canciller√≠a en la calle Jun√≠n. Es una unidad de reacci√≥n r√°pida principalmente para controlar disturbios. El mi√©rcoles, los efectivos de la UTOP estaban una cuadra m√°s all√° de la plaza restringiendo el ingreso de las personas al lugar del conflicto, parec√≠a que la Polic√≠a resguardaba a los militares api√±ados en plaza Murillo. En la calle Potos√≠, donde es uno de los ingresos a la Casa Grande del Pueblo hab√≠a como ocho camionetas de polic√≠as, no ingresaron a los garajes del palacio, estaban sobre la calle. Este jueves, no solo hab√≠a vuelto la UTOP sino que otras unidades como los Delta o los GEA, que estaban con todo su equipo, formaron barreras, cortaron el paso vehicular en todas los accesos y una camioneta giraba lentamente por toda la plaza ante la mirada curiosa de decenas de medios de comunicaci√≥n internacionales que arribaron al pa√≠s atra√≠dos por la noticia de un ‚Äògolpe de estado‚Äô. Seg√∫n el ministro de Defensa, Edmundo Novillo, todo hab√≠a vuelto a la tranquilidad ayer en la noche luego de que se retomara el control de los altos mandos. De hecho, los conscriptos de la Polic√≠a Militar que resguardaron la plaza desde mediod√≠a tuvieron que salir huyendo de la plaza Murillo a bordo de dos camiones que los trajeron desde la zona de San Jorge.

author: Express News Service
title: Uproar over temple tax Bill; BJP calls Cong ‚Äòanti-Hindu‚Äô, CM Siddaramaiah hits back
text:
BENGALURU: The Opposition BJP in Karnataka slammed the Congress State Government for passing the Karnataka Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Bill 2024 which mandates the government to collect 10% of revenue from temples whose revenue exceeds Rs 1 crore and 5% from temples whose revenue is between Rs 10 lakh and Rs 1 crore.
The Bill was passed in the state Assembly on Wednesday. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah hit back at the BJP saying that the allegations regarding the amendments to the Bill appear to be misrepresented for political gain. ‚ÄúThere has always been a mandate to create a common pool since the enactment of the Act in 1997,‚Äù he said. Siddaramaiah also said that the common pool is administered solely for religious purposes connected with the Hindu religion.
The CM said that the common pool fund has been utilised only for religious purposes of Hindu institutions since the Act came into force in 2003, and it will continue to be used for the same purposes in the future. ‚ÄúIt has not been utilised for any other purposes or the benefit of followers of other religions‚Äù he clarified. He denied there are misallocations of funds for non-Hindu purposes or the imposition of unfair taxes.
Endowment Minister Ramalinga Reddy, hitting out at state BJP president BY Vijayendra, said it is clear that the BJP always pursues political gains by claiming that Congress is anti-Hindu. ‚ÄúHowever, we, the Congress, consider ourselves the true proponents of Hinduism because, over the years, Congress governments have consistently safeguarded temples and Hindu interests,‚Äù Reddy said.
Reddy also said that when the BJP was in power between 2008 and 2013 and between 2019 and 2023, funds were collected from the temples that were getting the highest revenue. ‚ÄúIt seems they turned a blind eye to the revenues of Hindu religious institutions and charitable endowments, despite the existence of Acts or Bills in place since 2001. So, weren‚Äôt you also negligent regarding Hindu temple revenues?‚Äù Reddy asked.
Vijayendra had alleged that this Bill not only reflects the deplorable condition of the State Government but also shows its abject hate towards the Hindu dharma. ‚ÄúTemple funds should be dedicatedly utilised for the renovation of temples and to facilitate the work beneficial to devotees, rather than diverting it for other purposes, which would be an injustice and betrayal of people‚Äôs religious beliefs,‚Äù Vijayendra alleged. Many BJP leaders too made similar allegations.

author: Gabriela Calder√≥n de Burgos
title: El declive global de la libertad humana
text: Este mes el Instituto Cato y el Fraser Institute publicaron la √∫ltima edici√≥n del √çndice de Libertad Humana, que contiene datos de 2021 para 165 jurisdicciones, abarcando as√≠ un 98,8 % de la poblaci√≥n mundial. A diferencia del √çndice de Libertad Econ√≥mica del Fraser Institute, este √≠ndice es hasta ahora la medici√≥n m√°s comprensiva de la libertad en todas sus dimensiones, no solo la econ√≥mica. Con base en 86 indicadores de libertades econ√≥micas y personales, el √≠ndice provee un vistazo al estado de la libertad en las siguientes √°reas: (1) Estado de derecho, (2) seguridad, (3) libertad de movimiento, (4) religiosa, (5) de asociaci√≥n, (6) de expresi√≥n y acceso a la informaci√≥n, (7) de tener relaciones √≠ntimas y de familia, (8) de comercio, (9) el tama√±o del Estado, (10) sistema legal y derechos de propiedad y (11) las regulaciones. Las dos √∫ltimas ediciones del √≠ndice nos permiten ver el dram√°tico deterioro de la libertad humana que result√≥ de la pandemia del coronavirus. Los autores indican que, en una escala de 0 al 10, donde el 10 representa m√°s libertad, el puntaje promedio de libertad humana para 165 jurisdicciones descendi√≥ ligeramente, de 6,79 en 2020 a 6,75 en 2021. Entre 2019 y 2021, 89,8 % de la poblaci√≥n mundial experiment√≥ un declive en su libertad, siendo muchas m√°s las jurisdicciones que registraron una ca√≠da en su puntaje (146) que aquellas que presentaron una mejora (16). Las regiones que experimentaron la mayor ca√≠da en su puntaje durante los dos primeros a√±os de la pandemia son Norteam√©rica, Asia del Este, Am√©rica Latina y el Caribe. Lo interesante es que el declive en la libertad se ven√≠a dando desde 2007, cuando el mundo lleg√≥ a su punto m√°ximo de libertad promedio desde el a√±o 2000. Las jurisdicciones que m√°s ca√≠das han experimentado desde ese a√±o son Nicaragua, Rep√∫blica √Årabe de Siria, Hong Kong, Egipto, Turqu√≠a, Hungr√≠a, Bahrain, Venezuela, Burundi y El Salvador. La data muestra que los altos niveles de libertad est√°n concentrados en una peque√±a porci√≥n de la poblaci√≥n mundial: ‚ÄúSolo el 13,8 % de la poblaci√≥n mundial vive en el cuartil superior de los pa√≠ses del √≠ndice, mientras que el 37,6 % de la poblaci√≥n mundial vive en el cuartil inferior de los pa√≠ses con menores niveles de libertad‚Äù. China tiene mucho que ver con esta brecha de libertad, ya que, con su enorme poblaci√≥n, se ubica en el cuartil m√°s bajo del √≠ndice. Dentro de la regi√≥n, otro pa√≠s que ha experimentado un declive marcado desde el a√±o 2000 es Argentina. Uno de los autores, Ian V√°squez, se√±ala: ‚ÄúDurante los √∫ltimos veinte a√±os de gobierno populista-peronista, el nivel de libertad de Argentina no ha dejado de disminuir, y su clasificaci√≥n ha pasado de 41 en 2000 a 77 en el informe actual. Pero fue en t√©rminos de libertad econ√≥mica donde el pa√≠s sufri√≥ un colapso total, pasando del puesto 40 en 2000 al 158 en el nuevo √≠ndice‚Äù. Ecuador, en cambio, se ubica en la posici√≥n 72 -misma posici√≥n que obtuvo en el 2000-, mejorando en tan solo 0,6 su puntaje de libertad humana desde el 2000 (de 6,97 a 7,03). En los dos primeros a√±os de la pandemia el pa√≠s experiment√≥ un declive de 0,29 (de 7,38 a 7,03). Cabe notar que durante el corre√≠smo Ecuador lleg√≥ a ubicarse en la posici√≥n 97 en el a√±o 2014 con un puntaje de 6,76. (O)

author: VNExplorer
title: Ange Postecoglou slams VAR for not sending off Brighton star during Tottenham defeat
text:
Lewis Dunk wasn‚Äôt send off despite two reckless fouls on Dejan Kulusevski (Photo: Twitter / Getty)
Ange Postecoglou aimed another dig at VAR after Brighton captain Lewis Dunk escaped a red card during Tottenham‚Äôs 4-2 loss to the Seagulls.
Spurs were blown away at the Amex on Thursday night, with stunning strikes from Jack Hinshelwood and Pervis Estupinan and two Joao Pedro penalties putting Brighton 4-0 up.
The North Londoners rallied late on with goals from Alejo Veliz ‚Äì his first for the club ‚Äì and Ben Davies giving them hope, but it was too late for a miraculous comeback.
There was a moment of controversy in the build-up to Veliz‚Äôs goal however, with Dunk making a reckless challenge on Dejan Kulusevski.
Moreover, it wasn‚Äôt even the first time in the game that Dunk had made a studs up challenge on the Swede.
The England defender was booked for the second foul and will now miss Brighton‚Äôs next game against West Ham.
Postecoglou seemed to think it was a sending off offence and blasted the Video Assistant Referee for not getting involved, while also sarcastically praising them for the way they awarded the first penalty.
‚ÄòIt‚Äôs amazing that VAR picks up everything apart from a tackle that maybe puts out another of our players,‚Äô the manager said post-match.
‚ÄòThere are no grumbles from me with the penalties. They were clear and obvious. The first penalty was so clear and obvious it only took them three minutes to make the decision.‚Äô
Postecoglou added that he believed Kulusevski was ‚Äòokay‚Äô after the fouls.
The result has left Tottenham fifth in the table, six points off leaders Liverpool, and they will be hoping to bounce back when they host Bournemouth on New Year‚Äôs Eve.
‚ÄòLook, fair to say we were looking a bit tired and lacked our usual sharpness, especially at the start of the game,‚Äô the Spurs boss reflected.
‚ÄòWe‚Äôve been starting games well. I guess that‚Äôs understandable, we‚Äôve been on this run for a whole now and asking players to perform at levels.
‚ÄòIt‚Äôs very demanding the way we play physically and today we kind of looked like a team that wasn‚Äôt at its sharpest. Brighton are a good side and they took advantage of that.
‚ÄòUltimately what I do know is the players everything they had they gave and that‚Äôs all I can ask for.‚Äô
For more stories like this, check our sport page.
Follow Metro Sport for the latest news on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.
